creator: ricardo.gladwell@btinternet.com
text:
Setting the executable attribute does not over-ride the C-sharp compiler. To
reproduce attempt to execute the following and it will always default to using CSC:

    <csc executable="msc />

hmm. I dont see that is the case in the source. The only place the task binds to
csc is in the constructor, and then it switches from csc and mcs (notice, not
msc) depending on windows or not.

...

pause. 

no, it works. I get java.io.ioException: CreateProcess msc /nologoo...
 error=2

which is filenot found on msc
creator: stevel@apache.org
